io.zbox.zboxfs

Class Repo

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.zbox.zboxfs.Repo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class Repo
extends Object

    The Repo class represents an encrypted repository containing the whole file system.

    A Repo represents a secure collection which consists of files, directories and their associated data. Repo provides methods to manipulate the enclosed file system.

    Storages

    ZboxFS supports a variety of underlying storages, which are listed below.

    StorageURI identifier
    Memory"mem://"
    OS file system"file://"
    Zbox Cloud Storage"zbox://"

    * Visit zbox.io to learn more about Zbox Cloud Storage.

    Create and open repo

    Repo can be created on different underlying storage using RepoOpener. It uses an URI-like string to specify its storage type and location. The URI string starts with an identifier which specifies the storage type, as shown in above table. You can check more location URI details at RepoOpener.

    Repo can only be opened once at a time. After opened, it keeps locked from other open attempts until it is closed.

    Optionally, Repo can be opened in read-only mode if you only need read access.

    Examples

    Create an OS file system based repository.

     // initialise ZboxFS environment, called first and once
 Env.init(Env.LOG_DEBUG);

 // create a OS file system based repository
 try {
     Repo repo = new RepoOpener().create(true).open("file:///path/to/repo", "pwd");
     repo.close();
 } catch (ZboxException err) {
     System.out.println("Error: " + err);
 }

    Create a memory based repository.

     Repo repo = new RepoOpener().create(true).open("mem://foo", "pwd");

    Create a Zbox Cloud Storage repository.

     Repo repo = new RepoOpener().create(true).open("zbox://9ArJY6wMBULS7V3kXKxqv3XP@jJT5sSjAf3W5cW", "pwd");

    Open a repository in read-only mode.

     Repo repo = new RepoOpener()
                  .create(true)
                  .readOnly(true)
                  .open("mem://foo", "pwd");
    See Also:
    File

      • exists

        public static boolean exists(String uri)
                      throws ZboxException
        Returns whether the URI points at an existing repository.
        Parameters:
        uri - the repository URI
        Returns:
        true if repository existing, otherwise false
        Throws:
        ZboxException - if any error happened

      • resetPassword

        public void resetPassword(String oldPwd,
                          String newPwd,
                          OpsLimit opsLimit,
                          MemLimit memLimit)
                   throws ZboxException
        Reset password for the repository.

        Note: if this method failed due to IO error, super block might be damaged. If it is the case, use repairSuperBlock(String, String) to restore super block before re-opening the repo.

        Parameters:
        oldPwd - old password
        newPwd - new password
        opsLimit - password encryption operation limit
        memLimit - password encryption memory limit
        Throws:
        ZboxException - if any error happened
        See Also:
        repairSuperBlock(String, String)

      • repairSuperBlock

        public static void repairSuperBlock(String uri,
                                    String pwd)
                             throws ZboxException
        Repair possibly damaged super block.

        This method will try to repair super block using backup. One scenario is when resetPassword(String, String, OpsLimit, MemLimit) failed due to IO error, super block might be damaged. Using this method can restore the damaged super block from backup. If super block is all good, this method is no-op.

        This method is not useful for memory-based storage and must be called when repo is closed.

        Parameters:
        uri - repository URI
        pwd - password
        Throws:
        ZboxException - if any error happened
        See Also:
        resetPassword(String, String, OpsLimit, MemLimit)

      • copy

        public void copy(Path from,
                 Path to)
          throws ZboxException
        Copies the content of one file to another.

        This method will overwrite the content of to.

        from and to must be absolute paths to regular files.

        If from and to both point to the same file, this method is no-op.

        Parameters:
        from - absolute path of the source regular file
        to - absolute path of the target regular file
        Throws:
        ZboxException - if any error happened

      • copyDirAll

        public void copyDirAll(Path from,
                       Path to)
                throws ZboxException
        Copies a directory to another recursively.

        This method will overwrite the content of files in to with the files in from which have same relative location.

        from and to must be absolute paths to regular files.

        If to is not empty, the entire directory tree of from will be merged to to.

        This method will stop if any errors happened.

        If from and to both point to the same file, this method is no-op.

        Parameters:
        from - absolute path of the source directory
        to - absolute path of the target directory
        Throws:
        ZboxException - if any error happened

      • destroy

        public static void destroy(String uri)
                    throws ZboxException
        Permanently destroy a repository specified by uri.

        This will permanently delete all files and directories in a repository regardless it is opened or not. Use it with caution.

        Parameters:
        uri - repository URI
        Throws:
        ZboxException - if any error happened
